rule-23-1-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by baseline system 2 with a heatpump low shut off of less than 17 F. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 2 and 4, the electric air-source heat pumps shall be modeled with electric auxiliary heat and an outdoor air thermostat. The systems shall be controlled to energize auxiliary heat only when the outdoor air temperature is less than 40°F. The air-source heat pump shall be modeled to continue to operate while auxiliary heat is energized.

rule-23-1-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by baseline system 2 with a heatpump low shut off greater than 25 F. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 2 and 4, the electric air-source heat pumps shall be modeled with electric auxiliary heat and an outdoor air thermostat. The systems shall be controlled to energize auxiliary heat only when the outdoor air temperature is less than 40°F. The air-source heat pump shall be modeled to continue to operate while auxiliary heat is energized.

rule-23-1-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by baseline system 2 with a heatpump low shut off between 17 F and 25 F. The expected result is: undetermined

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 2 and 4, the electric air-source heat pumps shall be modeled with electric auxiliary heat and an outdoor air thermostat. The systems shall be controlled to energize auxiliary heat only when the outdoor air temperature is less than 40°F. The air-source heat pump shall be modeled to continue to operate while auxiliary heat is energized.

rule-23-1-d.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by baseline System 4 with a heat pump low shut off temperature below 10 F. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 2 and 4, the electric air-source heat pumps shall be modeled with electric auxiliary heat and an outdoor air thermostat. The systems shall be controlled to energize auxiliary heat only when the outdoor air temperature is less than 40°F. The air-source heat pump shall be modeled to continue to operate while auxiliary heat is energized.

rule-23-1-e.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by baseline System 4 with a heat pump low shut off temperature above 10 F. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 2 and 4, the electric air-source heat pumps shall be modeled with electric auxiliary heat and an outdoor air thermostat. The systems shall be controlled to energize auxiliary heat only when the outdoor air temperature is less than 40°F. The air-source heat pump shall be modeled to continue to operate while auxiliary heat is energized.

rule-23-2-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by baseline System 7 with a supply air temperature reset correctly set to 5 delta F. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8 and 11, the the supply air temperature shall be reset higher by 5°F under minimum cooling load conditions.

rule-23-2-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by baseline System 7  with supply air temperature reset but not correctly set to 5 delta F. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8 and 11, the the supply air temperature shall be reset higher by 5°F under minimum cooling load conditions.

rule-23-2-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by baseline System 7  with a does not have supply air temperature reset. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8 and 11, the the supply air temperature shall be reset higher by 5°F under minimum cooling load conditions.

rule-23-3-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7. The minimum outdoor airflow in System 7 is acceptably exactly 30% of primary airflow in both terminals. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8, the minimum volume setpoint shall be 30% of zone peak airflow, minimum outdoor airflow, or rate required to comply with minium accrediidation standards whichever is larger.

rule-23-3-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7. The minimum outdoor airflow in System 7 is acceptably greater than 30% of primary airflow in both terminals. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8, the minimum volume setpoint shall be 30% of zone peak airflow, minimum outdoor airflow, or rate required to comply with minium accrediidation standards whichever is larger.

rule-23-3-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7. The minimum outdoor airflow in System 7 is incorrectly less than 30% of primary airflow in both terminals. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8, the minimum volume setpoint shall be 30% of zone peak airflow, minimum outdoor airflow, or rate required to comply with minium accrediidation standards whichever is larger.

rule-23-4-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones and one  laboratory space served by  baseline System 7. Per G3.1.1c, these systems must adjust lab exhaust and makeup air.  The expected result is: undetermined

standard.rule_description: Baseline systems 5 and 7 serving lab spaces per Standard 90.1-2019 G3.1.1(c), shall reduce lab exhaust and makeup air during unoccupied periods to 50% of zone peak airflow, the minimum outdoor airflow, or rate required to comply with minimum accreditation standards whichever is larger.
standard.rule_dependency: System 5, 7 (Rule18-a, to be confirmed), lab space

rule-23-4-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone and one laboratory space served by baseline System 3. Per G3.1.1c, this only applies to system 5 and 7. The expected result is: not_applicable

standard.rule_description: Baseline systems 5 and 7 serving lab spaces per Standard 90.1-2019 G3.1.1(c), shall reduce lab exhaust and makeup air during unoccupied periods to 50% of zone peak airflow, the minimum outdoor airflow, or rate required to comply with minimum accreditation standards whichever is larger.
standard.rule_dependency: System 5, 7 (Rule18-a, to be confirmed), lab space

rule-23-5-a.test_description: Baseline system 6 with a terminal fan set to run at the first stage of heating before the reheat coil is turned on. Expected: PASS

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8, fans in parallel VAV fan-powered boxes shall run as the first stage of heating before the reheat coil is energized.

rule-23-5-b.test_description: Baseline system 8 with a terminal fan set to run at the first stage of heating before the reheat coil is turned on. Expected: PASS

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8, fans in parallel VAV fan-powered boxes shall run as the first stage of heating before the reheat coil is energized.

rule-23-5-c.test_description: Baseline system 6 with a terminal fan NOT set to run at the first stage of heating before the reheat coil is turned on. Expected: FAIL

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8, fans in parallel VAV fan-powered boxes shall run as the first stage of heating before the reheat coil is energized.

rule-23-5-d.test_description: Baseline system 8 with a terminal fan NOT set to run at the first stage of heating before the reheat coil is turned on. Expected: FAIL

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8, fans in parallel VAV fan-powered boxes shall run as the first stage of heating before the reheat coil is energized.

rule-23-6-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by system 6. VAV fans in system 6 are correctly sized to 50% of peak design load  with a performance efficiency of 0.35 W/cfm. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8, fans in parallel VAV fan-powered boxes shall be sized for 50% of the peak design primary air (from the VAV air-handling unit) flow rate and shall be modeled with 0.35 W/cfm fan power.

rule-23-6-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by system 6. VAV fans in system 6 are neither sized to 50% of peak design load  nor and have performance efficiency of greater than 0.35 W/cfm. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8, fans in parallel VAV fan-powered boxes shall be sized for 50% of the peak design primary air (from the VAV air-handling unit) flow rate and shall be modeled with 0.35 W/cfm fan power.

rule-23-7-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by system 6. System 6's fan system correctly specified temperature control as constant. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8,  supply air temperature setpoint shall be constant at the design condition

rule-23-7-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by system 6. System 6's fan system incorrectly specified temperature control as outside air reset. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 6 and 8,  supply air temperature setpoint shall be constant at the design condition

rule-23-8-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7. VAV fan follows the part load vav fan power as defined by method 1 in Table G3.1.3.15. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8 and 11 - part load vav fan power shall be modeled using either method 1 or 2 in Standard 90.1-2019 Table G3.1.3.15.

rule-23-8-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7. VAV fan does not follow the part load vav fan power defined by method 1 in Table G3.1.3.15. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline systems 5-8 and 11 - part load vav fan power shall be modeled using either method 1 or 2 in Standard 90.1-2019 Table G3.1.3.15.

rule-23-9-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11 with minimum volume setpoint set to 50% of the maximum design airflow rate. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, minimum volume setpoint shall be the largest of 50% of the maximum design airflow rate, the minimum ventilation airflow rate or the airflow required to comply with codes or accredidation standards.

rule-23-9-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11 with minimum volume setpoint set to greater than 50% of the maximum design airflow rate and minimum ventilation flow rate.  The expected result is: undetermined

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, minimum volume setpoint shall be the largest of 50% of the maximum design airflow rate, the minimum ventilation airflow rate or the airflow required to comply with codes or accredidation standards.

rule-23-9-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11 with minimum volume setpoint set to less than the minimum ventilation flow rate. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, minimum volume setpoint shall be the largest of 50% of the maximum design airflow rate, the minimum ventilation airflow rate or the airflow required to comply with codes or accredidation standards.

rule-23-10-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11 set to minimum airflow at 50% load.The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, fan volume shall be reset from 100% airflow at 100% load to minimum airflow at 50% load.

rule-23-10-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11 set to minimum airflow set at 25% load. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, fan volume shall be reset from 100% airflow at 100% load to minimum airflow at 50% load.

rule-23-10-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7 set to minimum airflow at 25% load. The expected result is: not_applicable

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, fan volume shall be reset from 100% airflow at 100% load to minimum airflow at 50% load.

rule-23-11-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11 with supply air temperature reset set to LOAD_RESET_TO_SPACE_TEMPERATURE and has a reset load fraction of 50%. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, supply air temperature shall be reset from minimum supply air temp at 50% cooling load to room temp at 0% cooling load.

rule-23-11-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11 with supply air temperature reset set to ZONE_RESET and has a reset temperature differential of 5 F. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, supply air temperature shall be reset from minimum supply air temp at 50% cooling load to room temp at 0% cooling load.

rule-23-11-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11 with supply air temperature reset set to ZONE_RESET and has a reset temperature differential of 10 F.  The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11, supply air temperature shall be reset from minimum supply air temp at 50% cooling load to room temp at 0% cooling load.

rule-23-12-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 11.1 and therefore is applicable to this rule. The expected result is: undetermined

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11 in heating mode, supply air temperature shall be modulated to maintain space temperature, and fan volume shall be fixed at minimum airflow

rule-23-12-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7. Therefore, this rule no longer applies. The expected result is: not_applicable

standard.rule_description: For baseline system 11 in heating mode, supply air temperature shall be modulated to maintain space temperature, and fan volume shall be fixed at minimum airflow

rule-23-13-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 3. Proposed building utilizes System 3 with humidistatic controls. The baseline system 3 uses mechanical cooling for dehumidication to avoid overcooling. The expected result is: undetermined

standard.rule_description: If proposed design includes humidistatic controls then the baseline shall use mechanical cooling for dehumidification and shall reheat to avoid overcooling.

rule-23-13-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 3. Proposed building utilizes System 3 without dehumidification. Baseline building also has system 3. The expected result is: not_applicable

standard.rule_description: If proposed design includes humidistatic controls then the baseline shall use mechanical cooling for dehumidification and shall reheat to avoid overcooling.

rule-23-14-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 3. Proposed building utilizes System 3 with humidistatic controls. The baseline building utilizes system 3 as well. The expected result is: undetermined

standard.rule_description: If the baseline system does not comply with exceptions in Standard 90.1-2019, Section 6.5.2.3 then only 25% of the system reheat energy shall be included in the baseline building performance

rule-23-14-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 3. Proposed building utilizes System 3 without dehumidification. Baseline building also has system 3.  The expected result is: not_applicable

standard.rule_description: If the baseline system does not comply with exceptions in Standard 90.1-2019, Section 6.5.2.3 then only 25% of the system reheat energy shall be included in the baseline building performance

rule-23-15-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 3. Proposed building utilizes System 3 with humidistatic controls. The baseline building utilizes system 3 as well.  The expected result is: undetermined

standard.rule_description: The dehumidification reheat type in the baseline building  shall be the same as the baseline system heating type.

rule-23-15-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by System 3. Proposed building utilizes System 3 without dehumidification. Baseline building also has system 3.  The expected result is: not_applicable

standard.rule_description: The dehumidification reheat type in the baseline building  shall be the same as the baseline system heating type.

rule-23-16-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7. The preheat coil is correctly controlled to 20 F less than the design room heating temperature setpoint. The expected result is: pass

standard.rule_description: Systrems 5 - 8, the baseline system shall be modeled with preheat coils controlled to a fixed set point 20°F less than the design room heating temperature setpoint.

rule-23-16-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by System 7. The preheat coil is incorrectly controled to only 13 F less than the design room heating temperature setpoint. Should be 20 F. The expected result is: fail

standard.rule_description: Systrems 5 - 8, the baseline system shall be modeled with preheat coils controlled to a fixed set point 20°F less than the design room heating temperature setpoint.
